metadata.title: CVE-2017-7798 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - medium.
metadata.description:
The Developer Tools feature suffers from a XUL injection vulnerability due to improper sanitization of the web page source code. In the worst case, this could allow arbitrary code execution when opening a malicious page with the style editor tool. This vulnerability affects Firefox ESR < 52.3 and Firefox < 55.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2017-7798` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 55.0.2+build1-0ubuntu4
firefox-geckodriver - 55.0.2+build1-0ubuntu4
firefox-mozsymbols - 55.0.2+build1-0ubuntu4
No subscription required

notes.note: tyhicks> mozjs38 contains a copy of the SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine

criterions.comment: firefox package in impish was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '55.0.2+build1-0ubuntu4').
